shredder 0.1.0

Working With brms

Source: vignettes/brms.Rmd
brms.Rmd
library(shredder)
library(brms)

Generate Data

group <- rep(c("treat", "placebo"), 
             each = 30)

symptom_post <- c(
  rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 2), 
  rnorm(30, mean = 0, sd = 1)
)

dat1 <- data.frame(group, symptom_post)

Run Model

fit <- brm(bf(symptom_post ~ group, sigma ~ group), 
           data = dat1, 
           family = gaussian())
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 4000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.06872   0.16960 -0.25878  0.39869 1.00200     4860     2977
sigma_Intercept  -0.08505   0.13617 -0.33386  0.19633 1.00043     3307     2491
grouptreat        0.86806   0.43712 -0.01414  1.70438 1.00068     2228     2134
sigma_grouptreat  0.86308   0.18831  0.49861  1.22414 1.00116     3231     2598

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Select first 100 Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_slice <- fit%>%stan_slice(1:100)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1100; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 400

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.07404   0.17761 -0.29244  0.39424 1.01349      446      341
sigma_Intercept  -0.08015   0.14408 -0.31844  0.18856 1.01052      353      238
grouptreat        0.88341   0.46203  0.07252  1.83834 1.00924      245      161
sigma_grouptreat  0.86692   0.19634  0.49147  1.20535 1.01035      394      290

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_slice%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Sample 25% of Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_sample <- fit%>%
  stan_sample_frac(0.25)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1250; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.06628   0.17045 -0.27764  0.38059 1.00284     1029      996
sigma_Intercept  -0.08812   0.13396 -0.33759  0.18756 1.00338     1178     1001
grouptreat        0.85035   0.42803 -0.04145  1.62965 1.00112      954      904
sigma_grouptreat  0.86015   0.18763  0.50021  1.22331 1.00038     1102      989

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_sample%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional

fit_filter <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=2)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1003; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 12

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.18337   0.21976 -0.49485  0.16020 0.92921        4        4
sigma_Intercept  -0.00070   0.10725 -0.18987  0.11883 0.87319        4        4
grouptreat        2.20742   0.13652  2.02085  2.42228 0.87319        4        4
sigma_grouptreat  0.89654   0.16457  0.62170  1.12456 1.09620        4        4

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional Subset Chain

fit_filter_chain <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=2)%>%
  stan_retain(chains = 1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 1 chains, each with iter = 1003; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 3

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.33086   0.12466 -0.41715 -0.19808 1.00000        3        3
sigma_Intercept   0.09920   0.01462  0.08607  0.11372 1.00000        3        3
grouptreat        2.32114   0.11333  2.21288  2.42820 1.00000        3        3
sigma_grouptreat  0.80224   0.21006  0.66208  1.02648 1.00000        3        3

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter_chain%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)
